title: Why does my fps drop to 7 in the game?
body: Hey guys,i turned my pc on today,i didn't jump in a game instead i went to get something and came back 30 minutes later,i jump into a game and i see that my fps dropped to 3-7 max,gladly the enemy team had to remake.I tried lowering the graphics(they were on medium) didn't do anything,i have a pretty decent pc,never had any problems with the game,even on my last pc which was 7 years old it never dropped so low,i didn't change anything in settings and i always had around 200-250 fps,my internet connection is normal as always(60-70 ms)i left my pc on for some time in the past and it never slowed the pc down.Does anyone know why does this happen/how can i fix it?Also i don't know if this is just me or for others too but i can't hover over someone's name in the friends list to see their rank and frequently played champion.I checked others games and then work like always.

replies.body:
If you're running Windows 10, you may be affected by the game DVR option that was enabled by the recent Anniversary Updates that went out. If you're on 10, I recommend working through [this guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to disable the game bar or just DVR to see if it changes anything.

Let me know what you experience.
likely some other process is running in the background of Windows. Could be antivirus, dropbox, windows udpates... whatever. Find it, and kill it.
